title: Create comprehensive stock market education website with difficulty-based organization

requirements.text: Create a homepage with clear navigation to three main difficulty level sections: Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced

quotes: the content should be organized by difficulty level
organized by difficulty levels (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced)

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage displays three clear sections or navigation options for Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced levels
Navigation is intuitive and accessible on all device sizes
Users can easily identify which section matches their experience level

requirements.text: Build Beginner section with foundational stock market content including: what stocks are, basic terminology, how stock markets work, and getting started with investing
acceptanceCriteria: Beginner section contains educational content on stock fundamentals
Content is written in simple, accessible language for complete beginners
Topics include stock definitions, basic market concepts, and introductory investing principles

requirements.text: Build Intermediate section with content on chart reading, technical analysis basics, fundamental analysis, trading strategies, and portfolio management
acceptanceCriteria: Intermediate section contains content on chart reading and analysis techniques
Content covers trading strategies and portfolio management concepts
Material assumes basic stock market knowledge and builds upon it

requirements.text: Build Advanced section with content on advanced trading strategies, risk management techniques, options and derivatives, market psychology, and sophisticated analysis methods
acceptanceCriteria: Advanced section contains sophisticated investment and trading content
Content includes risk management strategies and complex financial instruments
Material is suitable for experienced investors seeking to deepen their knowledge

requirements.text: Create a searchable glossary of stock market terms accessible from all pages, with clear definitions and examples for each term

quotes: Searchable glossary of stock market terms

acceptanceCriteria: Glossary includes comprehensive stock market terminology
Search functionality allows users to quickly find term definitions
Each term includes a clear definition and practical example
Glossary is accessible from any page via navigation

requirements.text: Implement step-by-step tutorials and lessons throughout each difficulty level section, with clear progression from one concept to the next
acceptanceCriteria: Each difficulty level contains structured tutorials with step-by-step instructions
Tutorials flow logically from basic to more complex concepts within each level
Each tutorial clearly indicates prerequisites and learning objectives

requirements.text: Add visual examples and diagrams throughout the content to illustrate stock market concepts, including chart patterns, market trends, and investment strategies
acceptanceCriteria: Educational content includes relevant visual diagrams and examples
Visuals effectively illustrate complex stock market concepts
Images and diagrams are responsive and display properly on all devices

requirements.text: Create quick reference guides and cheat sheets that summarize key concepts, formulas, and strategies for easy access

quotes: Quick reference guides or cheat sheets

acceptanceCriteria: Quick reference section provides concise summaries of key stock market concepts
Cheat sheets include important formulas, definitions, and strategies
Reference materials are easily accessible and downloadable or printable

requirements.text: Design a cohesive, professional visual theme that conveys trust and financial expertise while remaining approachable for beginners, using a sophisticated color palette with clean typography and well-structured layouts
acceptanceCriteria: Visual design uses a professional color scheme appropriate for financial education
Typography is clear and readable across all content sections
Layout maintains consistency across all difficulty levels and pages
Design balances professionalism with approachability for all user levels

constraints: All content must be organized by the three difficulty levels: Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced
Website must be responsive and work seamlessly on all devices
Navigation must remain intuitive and accessible for users of all experience levels
nonGoals: Real-time stock price data or live market feeds
User accounts or personalized learning paths
Interactive trading simulations or practice accounts
Financial advice or personalized investment recommendations

required: Professional hero banner image showing financial charts and growth concepts for the homepage (hero-banner.dim_1200x400.png)
Icon illustration representing beginner level with simple upward trend (beginner-icon.dim_128x128.png)
Icon illustration representing intermediate level with multiple chart lines (intermediate-icon.dim_128x128.png)
Icon illustration representing advanced level with complex analytical graphics (advanced-icon.dim_128x128.png)
Diagram showing bull and bear market patterns (bull-bear-diagram.dim_800x400.png)
Visual chart showing candlestick pattern examples (candlestick-patterns.dim_600x400.png)
